title: 91/212/EEC: Commission Decision of 11 March 1991 on the establishment of an addendum to the Community support framework for Community structural assistance in Ireland on the improvement of the conditions under which fishery and aquaculture products are processed and marketed (Only the English text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 11 March 1991 on the establishment of an addendum to the Community support framework for Community structural assistance in Ireland on the improvement of the conditions under which fishery and aquaculture products are  processed and marketed (Only the English text is authentic) (91/212/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 1 The addendum to the Community support framework for Community structural assistance on the improvement of the conditions under which fishery and aquaculture products are processed and marketed in Ireland, covering the period 1 January 1991 to  31 December 1993, is hereby approved.
The Commission declares that it intends to contribute to the implementation of this addendum to the Community support
framework in accordance with the detailed provisions thereof and in compliance with the rules and guidelines of the Structural Funds and the other existing financial instruments.  Article 2 The addentum to the Community support framework contains the following essential information:
(a)  a statement of the main priorities for joint action:
1.  processing of fishery and aquaculture products;
2.  marketing of fishery and aquaculture products;
(b)
an indicative financing plan specifying, at constant 1991 prices, the total cost of the priorities adopted for joint action by the Community and the Member State concerned together with the existing national initiatives (integrated Mediterranean  programmes), ECU 38,000 million for the whole period, and the financial arrangements envisaged for budgetary assistance from the Community, broken down as follows:
(million ECU)
a)
1.  Processing of fishery and aquaculture
products
8,000
2.  Marketing of fishery and aquaculture
products
2,000
The resultant national financing requirement, approximately ECU 7,600 million for the public sector and ECU 20,400 million for the private sector, may be partially covered by Community loans from the European Investment Bank and the other loan  instruments.  Article 3 This declaration of intent is addressed to Ireland.
